a2: From 2015 to 2022 the number of people lacking electricity dropped from 958 million to 685 million. Over the same time period, the number of people without clean cooking fuels declined from 2.8 billion to 2.1 billion. Despite this, an estimated 660 million people will still lack electricity access and around 1.8 billion will go without clean cooking fuels and technologies by 2030.
b2: Changing weather patterns, rising sea levels, and more frequent weather events are some of the impacts climate change has had on the world.
c2: Between 2015 and 2019, at least 100 million hectares of healthy and productive land were degraded every year, impacting the lives of 1.3 billion people.
